result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Magnuson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
03/09/2016 CORRECTED TO INDICATE TAYCHEEDAH CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTION AS RECEPTION FACILITY.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.   Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must successfully complete Barron County Drug Court Program. Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

06/14/2016 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS 72 HOURS JAIL WITHOUT HUBER BEGINNING AT 12:30 PM TODAY, JUNE 14, 2016.

9:59 AM Defendant Michelle L Magnuson in court. Drug Court Team present in court and by Zoom video. 
Living with core values of responsibility, honesty, integrity, and humility.  Meetings are made and documented. Sweat patch results given.  Work hours verified.

587 days sober today.
GRADUATION DAY!
Michelle has friends and family here today.  
She got a promotion at work and is happy about it.
Michelle reads a letter to the court about addiction and her journey.
Court commends Michelle on her accomplishments and how proud the team is of her and not the end, but just a continuation of her decision to have more and better in her life.  
Dan relates on her commitment not to cut corners and commends her on pushing herself to keep her sobriety.   Court presents Michelle with a certificate.  Kara relates on Michelle's journey and progress for her recovery and setting boundaries.  Kara is super proud of Michelle.
